data.title: Auto indent for JS pushes 4 spaces even if my file is 2 spaces and my config is 2 spaces
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1 (1.7.1)
- OS Version: OSX 10.12.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Try a block of code like below

```Javascript
const data = () => {
  return {
    media_id: ''+(new Date()).getTime(),
    comments: [
      {
        username: 'foo',
        comment: 'bar'
      }
    ]  
  }
} // <-- Add a semicolon here 
```
2. Then add an `;` on the last bracket  

It will push 4 spaces over all the structure of the func data

My Config

```JSON
// Place your settings in this file to overwrite the default settings
{
  "workbench.editor.enablePreview": false,

  "editor.wrappingColumn": 0,
  "editor.fontFamily": "menlo",
  "editor.fontSize": 16,
  "editor.fontLigatures": true,
  "editor.tabSize": 2,
  "editor.lineHeight": 20,
  "editor.detectIndentation": false,
  "editor.rulers": [
    80,
    100,
    120
  ],
  "editor.renderIndentGuides": true,
  "editor.renderWhitespace": "all",
  "editor.tabCompletion": true,
  "editor.formatOnType": true,
  "editor.selectionHighlight": true,
  "editor.cursorStyle": "line",
  "editor.renderControlCharacters": true,

  "tslint.enable": true,
  "tslint.run": "onSave",
  "eslint.run": "onType",
  
  "explorer.openEditors.visible": 0,

  "files.exclude": {
    "**/.git": true,
    "**/.svn": true,
    "**/.hg": true,
    "**/.DS_Store": true,
    "**/node_modules": true,
    "**/*.pyc": true,
    "**/*.zip": true
  },

  "search.exclude": {
    "**/node_modules": true,
    "**/bower_components": true,
    "**/deps": true
  },

  "go.buildOnSave": false
}```

data.title: Windows VS Code will not traverse RHEL 7.2 Symlink (Really don't want to use sublime which CAN!!!)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Win 7 Pro

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  any linux
2. target fs /opt/uid
3. ln -s /opt/uid /home/uid/myopt
4. SFTP Net Drive Win 7 to linuxserver:/home/uid
5. open folder symlink
    Path does not exist
    The path Z:/myopt does not seem to exist anymore on disk.

NOTE, sublime has NO TROUBLE traversing the symlink
I REALLY HOPE that MS does not give us the usual BS answer that it can't be done.
This is one of the most wonderful products out there.  I would hate to have to regress to sublime because I can not work in my clients secure work environment.

data.title: Add option to remember directory of file opened via command line
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open VSC, open a file `D:\foo\a.txt` via menu File -> Open File. Close VSC.
2. Open Command Prompt, open a file `D:\bar\a.txt` via command line.
3. Close VSC and open it again. Try to open a file via menu File -> Open File, the file chooser dialog is opened with initial directory `D:\foo` (in step 1).

I think the file choose directory in step 3 should open with initial directory `D:\bar`. If you think so, please fix  `:-D`

Thank you,

data.title: Can't open the vscode on CentOS & Arch that was due to lack of the libXss.so.1
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: CenOS7; Arch

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Download the vscode(.rpm or .tar.gz) and try to open the vscode
2. Open the vscode with the Command

Expected:
The vscode can be open correctly.

Actual:
The vscode can't be open. when I tried open it with command, it pop up a following error message:
![vscode](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20184768/20201828/e21e5326-a7f5-11e6-8a62-23cb280c3b8b.PNG)

Investigation:
The issue can reproduce on CentOS and Arch, I tried install the libXss.so.1 with the 'sudo yum install libXScrnSaver libXScrnSaver-devel' in cmd, and I tried to open the vs, it can be open normally.

data.title: Use :: as a comment for batch language
data.body: `REM` stands for 'remark' what is a comment but in a different sense. A syntax for a comment in a meaning of an annotation that does nothing other just comment a code is double colon `::`

data.title: VS Code doesn't send 'pause' request to the debug adapter when the button is hit
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.8.0-insider, Commit 2583c1d1d2bb5430a899800523781c8d68cf98bb
(Though it is broken in the current live bits too)
- OS Version: Windows 10 (build 14393) though it is broken on other platforms also

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install the C# extension
2. Install .NET Core per https://www.microsoft.com/net/core
3. Open the attached project
4. Hit F5 to launch
5. Hit the pause icon

Result:
VS Code doesn't send a 'pause' request to the C# debugger, and no error is shown.

data.title: Trying to start the debugger two times in a row ends in a "endless loop"
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.7.1 (02611b40b24c9df2726ad8b33f5ef5f67ac30b44, 2016-11-03T13:53:14.822Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|Go|lukehoban|0.6.48|

There seems to be a problem with the debugger.
Once you try to start it two times it starts and will nerver end.

Note to the "Steps to Reproduce":
I do not do the exact same thing. In reality i try to resolve my bug between steps 2 and 3.
So i change and save one or more files. But the process in "Steps to Reprocuce" is the simplest way to reproduce.

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Produce a compile error in your golang project
2. Try to start the debugger. It will output a error in the DEBUG CONSOLE and nothing else happens.
3. Try to start the debugger a second time. The "Debug Toolbar" appears. The Progress blue line above the side bar is "spinning" and clicking on the stop symbol on the debug toolbar doesn't do anything

data.title: Keyboard Shortcut for editor.action.format not working
data.body:
Smoke Testing 1.7.2

- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: Windows

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Add a keyboard shortcut for `editor.action.format`
```
{
   "key": "ctrl+shift+w",
   "command": "editor.action.format"
}
```

2. Use the shortcut on any js or ts file

Expected : File gets formatted
Actual     : No Change

The Right Click -> Format Document works though

data.title: Feature Request: Hide Activity Bar
data.body:
Would be cool to be able to hide the Activity Bar, for Zen mode or for Presentations.

I'm currently making videos about code and I use Markdown viewer too.

I would really like to hide the Activity bar during these videos, and sometimes just for me while coding.

data.title: Prevent scrolling to the selected file when you switch between tabs
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: Windows, Linux

Steps to Reproduce:

1. A long list with files that cause a scrollbar in the explorer on the left
2. Open some files from a different location in the explorer
3. Switch tabs in the editor and see the explorer scrolling to the selected file

When you select a tab in the editor the explorer on the left will highlight the concerning file and scroll automatically to it. Sometimes the scroll behavior is very confusing. In some situations you want to switch between tabs but keep sight on the current file structure. 

It will be great if this behavior can be disabled with a workspace option like this:

`{"explorer.highlightFileFromTab": false}`

data.title: Allow to copy workspace relative path of file from explorer
data.body:
- VSCode Version:  1.8.0-insider (1.8.0-insider)
- OS Version: 10.12.1 (16B2555

In addition to the Tree sidebar having "copy path" (which returns the entire disk path), it would be nice to additionally have "copy project path" (which would be the relative path from project root).

Atom has this, and it's very useful.

data.title: Test: manual launching of multiple debug processes
data.body:
- [x] OS X  **@jrieken** 
- [x] Windows **@roblourens** 

complexity: 4

As requested in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/14338 we now support starting multiple debug sessions by clicking on the debug start action multiple times. Have a workspace with mutiple launch configurations and verify:
* You can start multiple debug sessions via debug start action (you can only do this if you try to launch different configurations)
* Once you are debugging two processes a dropdown appears in the floating debug actions widget
* Switching processes via this dropdown opens the appropriate stack frame in the editor and all debug actions get scoped for that process
* Clicking on the stack frames in the call stack view opens those stack frames in the editor and all actions get scoped for the process of that stack frame
* Each Process and Thread show their status in the call stack view

data.title: Warn users that their default editor will be affected when installing on Windows 10
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.7.1 (02611b40b24c9df2726ad8b33f5ef5f67ac30b44, 2016-11-03T13:53:14.822Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Run the installer on Windows 10.
2. See that `Register Code as an editor for supported file types` is checked by default, with no warning about any consequences of leaving it checked.
3. After installation, try to open any affected file-type and your default editor will no longer open automatically. Instead you will receive the Windows dialog that asks what program to open the file type with.

I don't know if anybody at Microsoft is still using Windows, but it's really annoying to have all of your default file openers reset. Especially for a programming tool that affects about 20 or 30 different file types that I use on a regular basis like `*.js, *.css, *.less, *.jade, etc.`.

data.title: Copyright Symbol Not Encoding Properly in UTF-8
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: Windows 8.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Open an existing file that has the  symbol (this was tested on a .sql file)
2.  Notice that the symbol changes to  while in UTF-8

Assuming this is not correct, considering Notepad++ does not do this in UTF-8 encoding.
[testFile.txt](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/589485/testFile.txt)
